questions.quote: My mother left us when I was six years old. All seven of us. We never heard from her again. I hope she's rotting in an alley somewhere!
Well, you remember I told you about the pro, you know, at the Westchester Country Club, who's letting me play a round every time I give him a couple of those Cuban cigars?
Yeah, well when you don't actually do the steps, you can go through them pretty quick. You can get through six a day.
This is like a Penthouse letter...Why can't I meet women like this?
Not really. My friend was supposed to pick me up, but I don't know where he is.
So--ah, Kramer. Why'd you ask me out to dinner?  An' why Pomodoro?
Well, actually, Jerry, we wanted to talk to you about something.
Well, I thought it was a nice gesture. But I guess I was wrong!
I--I've been, walkin' around all night.. I've been thinkin' about Allison and me.. an' you--
Uhm, listen, I really felt bad about what happened, and I, I, I'd really like to apologise. Can I come up?
